page.title: 07VILLAGE HOUSES
page.content: Most houses are built of Cotswold stone, a few have thatched roofs. Others have slate roofs. A few are built of brick. They have main services of electricity, piped water and sewage disposal. There is no mains gas supply so solid fuel, Calor Gas or electricity are used for cooking and heating. Most households have a refrigerator and/or a freezer. Milk and bread are delivered, but other groceries have to be bought in Oxford or Kidlington. In Woodeaton most houses are owned by Christchurch College and are rented. In Elsfield many houses are also owned by Christchurch College and are let to tenants. Elsfield Manor House is divided into flats. Some houses date from the 17th Century. A few of the cottages are tied to local farms.
